p.s: Chris seems to be a popular student at Williamson, because nearly everyone he walks past looks at him.
He gives handshakes to everybody on his right.
In the first part of the scene, Chris is filmed from a medium shot perspective and a lower angle.
This makes him look big and attractive.
In the second important shot, Starr is shown from a medium close up perspective on eye level.
The camera slowly comes closer to her.
Her attention is on Chris'sChris' shoes (Jordans), which are shown in the next shot from a medium close up perspective and a higher angle to turn the focus on them.
The next important shot is the big close up when Starr turns her back to Chris.
This is important to show how Starr's mimics are at beginning and after Chris had put on his headphones on her head.
With this shot size you can clearly see how Starr's mimics change from serious to amused and back to serious.
The next shot is a medium long shot, it shows how Starr gives Chris back his headphones.
The camera starts to switch from Starr's to Chris'sChris' face and back again.
Both faces are shown in a close up, which should show their mimics and feelings during the conversation.
After the conversation, Chris starts to dance in a medium shot again.
With this shot the focus is on his hand movements synchronized to the music.
Starr looks at him from a close up perspective and you can clearly see her laughing face.
You can see the difference between her seriously face some minutes ago.
All in all the shot sizes describe how Chris repairs the a bit broken relationship with Starr.
